outputs.label: enriched_request
outputs.description: This request should come from request-enricher

inputs.label: use_context
inputs.description: When true, include this run's active context messages (context.messages) in the LLM request. If the pin is not connected, the node checkbox is used. Default: false.

inputs.label: provider
inputs.description: LLM provider id (e.g. LMStudio). If unset, uses the node’s configured provider.

inputs.label: model
inputs.description: LLM model id/name. If unset, uses the node’s configured model.

inputs.label: system
inputs.description: Optional system prompt for this single call.

inputs.label: prompt
inputs.description: User prompt/content for this single call.

inputs.label: tools
inputs.description: Allowlist of tools exposed to the model as ToolSpecs (model may request tool calls; execution is done via a Tool Calls node).

inputs.label: structured_output
inputs.description: Optional JSON Schema object (type=object) the assistant content must conform to.

outputs.label: response
outputs.description: Assistant text content (best-effort). For tool calls, content may be empty.

outputs.label: tool_calls
outputs.description: Normalized tool call requests (same as result.tool_calls). This pin exists to make wiring into Tool Calls / Emit Event nodes simpler.

outputs.label: result
outputs.description: Full normalized LLM result (content, tool_calls, usage, provider/model metadata, trace_id).

pinDefaults.system: You are an expert scheduler who works like Map/Reduce : you decompose the request you receive into a series of IDENTICAL but small tasks (eg if you must read 500 files and have 100 agents, each agent will be given 5 files to read), so that each sub-task can be executed in parallel by a large number of small agents. As your role is to initialize those agents, you must output 1) a system prompt common to all small agents (they will run the SAME TYPE of task) 2) a set of tools based on your available tool names (again, SAME TYPE of task = need same type of tools) and 3) for each task, a dedicated user prompt informing on the agent specific task. Example : { “system_prompt” : “xxx”, “tools”: [ list_files, read_file…], tasks : [ {“user_prompt” : “read files xx1, xx2, xx3 and report the key insights”}, {“user_prompt” : “read the files xx4, xx5, xx6 and report the key insights”}, … ]

system_prompt.description: the system_prompt shared by all small agents to accomplish a similar task

tools.description: the array of tool names specifying the tool each agent will have access to

tasks.description: the list of task given to an agent as a user prompt, each item having a structure : { "user_prompt" : "my_personal_task" }

inputs.label: use_context
inputs.description: When true, include this run's active context messages (context.messages) as agent history. If the pin is not connected, the node checkbox is used. Default: false.

inputs.label: provider
inputs.description: LLM provider id (e.g. LMStudio). If unset, uses the node’s configured provider.

inputs.label: model
inputs.description: LLM model id/name. If unset, uses the node’s configured model.

inputs.label: max_iterations
inputs.description: Maximum internal ReAct iterations (safety cap). Higher values allow more tool-use steps.

inputs.label: system
inputs.description: Optional system prompt for this agent instance (high priority instructions).

inputs.label: prompt
inputs.description: The task/user prompt for the agent to solve.

inputs.label: tools
inputs.description: Allowlist of tool names this agent can call (defense-in-depth; runtime still enforces allowlists).

inputs.label: structured_output
inputs.description: Optional JSON Schema object (type=object) the final answer must conform to.

inputs.label: context
inputs.description: Optional explicit context object for the agent (e.g. {messages:[...]}). If provided, it can override inherited run context.

outputs.label: result
outputs.description: Structured final agent result (answer + metadata/tool calls depending on agent).

outputs.label: tool_calls
outputs.description: Best-effort list of tool call requests extracted from the agent scratchpad trace (post-run). For real-time tool observability, subscribe to the ledger/node_traces stream.

outputs.label: tool_results
outputs.description: Best-effort list of tool results extracted from the agent scratchpad trace (post-run). For real-time tool observability, subscribe to the ledger/node_traces stream.

outputs.label: scratchpad
outputs.description: Runtime-owned execution trace/scratchpad for observability (LLM/tool steps, timings).

pinDefaults.system: You are an expert scheduler who works like Map/Reduce : you decompose the request you receive into a series of IDENTICAL but small tasks (eg if you must read 500 files and have 100 agents, each agent will be given 5 files to read), so that each sub-task can be executed in parallel by a large number of small agents. As your role is to initialize those agents, you must output 1) a system prompt common to all small agents (they will run the SAME TYPE of task) 2) a set of tools based on your available tool names (again, SAME TYPE of task = need same type of tools) and 3) for each task, a dedicated user prompt informing on the agent specific task. Example : { “system_prompt” : “xxx”, “tools”: [ list_files, read_file…], tasks : [ {“user_prompt” : “read files xx1, xx2, xx3 and report the key insights”}, {“user_prompt” : “read the files xx4, xx5, xx6 and report the key insights”}, … ]  CRITICAL : before being able to truly decompose a problem into tasks, you often have to execute one or more tools yourself first, for instance, to have the full list of files

inputs.label: value
inputs.description: JSON value (or JSON-ish string) to stringify.

inputs.label: mode
inputs.description: Rendering mode: none | beautify | minified. Default beautify.

result.system_prompt: You are a document summarizer. Your task is to read and summarize one markdown file from the backlog directory. Extract key insights, main objectives, technical requirements, and any critical dependencies or implications. Keep summaries concise (under 200 words) and structured: Title, Summary, Key Points. Do not include metadata like file size or path unless relevant.

inputs.label: use_context
inputs.description: When true, include this run's active context messages (context.messages) in the LLM request. If the pin is not connected, the node checkbox is used. Default: false.

inputs.label: provider
inputs.description: LLM provider id (e.g. LMStudio). If unset, uses the node’s configured provider.

inputs.label: model
inputs.description: LLM model id/name. If unset, uses the node’s configured model.

inputs.label: system
inputs.description: Optional system prompt for this single call.

inputs.label: prompt
inputs.description: User prompt/content for this single call.

inputs.label: tools
inputs.description: Allowlist of tools exposed to the model as ToolSpecs (model may request tool calls; execution is done via a Tool Calls node).

inputs.label: structured_output
inputs.description: Optional JSON Schema object (type=object) the assistant content must conform to.

outputs.label: response
outputs.description: Assistant text content (best-effort). For tool calls, content may be empty.

outputs.label: tool_calls
outputs.description: Normalized tool call requests (same as result.tool_calls). This pin exists to make wiring into Tool Calls / Emit Event nodes simpler.

outputs.label: result
outputs.description: Full normalized LLM result (content, tool_calls, usage, provider/model metadata, trace_id).

inputs.label: tool_calls
inputs.description: List of tool call requests (or a single call). Typical shape: {name, arguments, call_id?}. Often comes from LLM Call.result.tool_calls.

inputs.label: allowed_tools
inputs.description: Optional allowlist of tool names enforced by the runtime effect handler (empty list => allow none). If not connected, the node config (if any) is used.

outputs.label: results
outputs.description: Per-call results in input order (each entry includes output/error metadata). Use this for debugging or to feed structured tool outputs into the graph.

outputs.label: success
outputs.description: True if all tool calls succeeded (no per-call error).
